key_points: WTI crude futures rose to $60.09 a barrel, up 24% in 2021, and touched a session high of $60.77, the highest since January 2020.
Brent crude climbed 1.4% to $63.33, reaching a 13-month high.
Freezing weather across the U.S. increased demand for power and fuel while posing a threat to oil production.
Cold conditions are expected to affect oil production in Canada, North Dakota, Oklahoma, Texas, and elsewhere.
Over 150 million Americans are currently under some form of winter weather advisory.
A major winter storm is predicted to bring heavy snow and significant ice across various regions.
Oil analyst Andy Lipow highlighted the potential severe impacts of cold weather on the oil industry.
Frigid weather can lead to the shutting in of oil wells due to equipment freezing.
The ongoing winter storm may lead refineries to slow operations and prepare for outages.
A steady rise in gasoline prices over the last week can be partly attributed to the storm.
